snippet: Republicans have forced President Obama to swallow three changes that undermine his signature health care law, including a two-year delay of a tax on high-cost insurance plans provided by employers to workers.
abstract: Congress is poised to approve delays that would likely weaken Pres Obama's health care law; most notably, plan would push back start of Cadillac tax, which is designed to slow growth of health care costs, to 2020.
lead_paragraph: Republicans have forced President Obama to swallow three changes that undermine his signature health care law, including a two-year delay of a tax on high-cost insurance plans provided by employers to workers.

headline.main: In Likely Spending Plan, Congress Readies Blows to Obama’s Health Care Law
headline.print_headline: In Likely Spending Plan, Congress Readies Blows to Obama’s Health Care Law

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
